chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: In today's video, we will learn about Core Web Vitals and why they are important.  Like this video and keep your energy high.  The thing is that your website should run on all devices in iPad, iPhone, Android, Surface Pro 4.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Because we have to give a good experience to all users through our website.  In this video, we will also learn that there is a hidden tool in Chrome called Lighthouse.  And how you can use it to enhance your website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So write in the comment section below, Sigma Batch OP.  Let's go to the computer screen. Let's roll the intro.  So guys, I have come here to my computer screen.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And now I will make a new folder whose name is Video 6.  Video 6 and here in Video 6, I will open VS Code as always.  And the thing I am going to tell you today is very important from the aspect of SEO.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: First of all, I want to tell you what is SEO?  SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization.  If you see any website, then SEO is there in it.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Let's take the example of Amazon.in.  I opened Amazon.in, so Amazon.in wants this website to be loaded as soon as possible.  So that their products can come in search.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Google is a search engine.  Google's responsibility is to show the best pages to the users.  So Google wants to show only those pages that are fast,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Present information very well,  And along with that, there are some things in them that the user has a good experience.  For example, let's say there are two pages.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: One page has told about dog food.  The other page has also told about dog food exactly the same time.  But the page 2 of these two is loaded very fast.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: It loads well, so Google will give it more preference.  Along with that, there are core web vitals that Google considers to rank two pages.  First of all, content is important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: What is on your page?  If your content is good, then your website can rank without core web vitals.  But if you are competing with a page that has presented almost similar quality content,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Then your core web vitals will be seen.  And if your core web vitals are good, then you will be given preference.  So the first thing that comes in the core web vitals is your CLS.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: You see this video here, which I have run from the web.dev website.  You will see that someone comes to your website and he is trying to cancel the order here.  And by mistake, the time he canceled, this thing above became visible.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And he shifted the layout and the order was completed.  But the user wanted the order to be incomplete, he wanted to click on no.  In this case, the user experience is very bad.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And as you saw in this video, it should not be like this.  That's why our CLS should be as low as possible.  Now what is the definition of CLS?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Cumulative layout shift means how much is shifting while the page is loading.  Suppose you have loaded the page and first of all you get to see this.  This was above and then when this key term part was loaded, then everything was shifted below.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: The layout should not be shifted.  If you put width and height in images, then the layout will not shift.  The next metric we are going to talk about is LCP.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: And LCP stands for Largest Contextual Paint.  This means that if the user is viewing a page, then the biggest element on it.  For example, the biggest part in this is this image.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: How long is it loading?  Means the whole page will be loaded, but the biggest element which is the most important,  How long is it loading?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: According to web.dev and google, a good LCP score should be 2.5 seconds.  That is, the biggest element of the page should be loaded in 2.5 seconds.  After this comes the third metric which is FID.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: Which stands for First Input Delay.  First Input Delay means that if any user has clicked on any input element,  Like on a button or any type of input on a page,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So how long does that input process?  For example, if you click on a button, then how long does that button click browser process?  And according to google and web.dev, your input should start processing in less than 100 milliseconds.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML
chunks.text: So these were the three core web vitals which are very important.  For your information, these core web vitals are also updated.  But these three are very important and you should know.

chunks.text: Now I will show you what is the lighthouse report and why do they generate?  And how will these three core web vitals get value from there?  So I tell you here, if you inspect by right-clicking,
